Key Match Events: Germany defeated Scotland 5-1 in the UEFA European Championship Finals on 14/06/2024.
Florian Wirtz scored in the 10th minute.
Jamal Musiala scored in the 19th minute.
Kai Havertz scored in the 45+1 minute.
Niclas Füllkrug scored in the 68th minute.
Emre Can scored in the 90+3 minute.
Ryan Porteous received a red card in the 45th minute.
Antonio Rüdiger received a yellow card in the 87th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Billy Gilmour expressed admiration for Toni Kroos and discussed his excitement about playing against him.
Gilmour highlighted the importance of teamwork and not focusing solely on one player.
Gilmour mentioned the need for Scotland to keep possession to compete with Germany.
Post-Match Reflections: Billy Gilmour reflected on his previous experiences and the importance of confidence and composure on the pitch.
Gilmour discussed the emotional rollercoaster of Euro 2020 and his positive Covid-19 test that ended his tournament early.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place in Munich’s Allianz Arena with a vibrant opening ceremony.
The Tartan Army, Scotland's fans, were present in large numbers, creating a lively atmosphere.
